task.title: Using a Font on Your Site
task.shortdesc: The font you choose and how you implement it can have a positive impact on the impression it makes and its ease of use.

taskbody.prereq: User must know the difference between CSS and HTML

step.cmd: Have the content and main elements mapped out in an HTML file.
Begin a separate or internal CSS file/section which the HTML file can pull rules from.
Gain an understanding of which size, color, and weight schemes are visually pleasing.
Decide on the particular scheme you might use.
Set up the rules for your fonts based on which type of text elements exist in the HTML file.
View the finished product and make any adjustments based on the final output.
